alttext="5"><semantics><mn>5</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>​​The table gives ordered pairs for five points from a larger data set. The larger data set can be modeled by a sinusoidal function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> with a period of <math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The maximum values of the data set occur at <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values that are multiples of <math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following best defines <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for the larger data set?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="cos open parentheses pi over 2 x close parentheses plus 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="cos open parentheses pi x close parentheses plus 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="2 cos open parentheses pi over 2 x close parentheses plus 4"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="2 cos open parentheses pi x close parentheses plus 4"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="cos open parentheses pi over 2 x close parentheses plus 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
